definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
brontometer/apparatus to measure thunder and lightning

sentences.english: The Thunderbolt gained fame as the most powerful and actively used American fighter-bomber used extensively for targeting ground installations.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到雷電因此成爲了美國最著名的戰鬥轟炸機。

sentences.english: Sometimes you can see where it has hit because you see the bolt coming in.
sentences.chinese: 有時你會看到雷電擊中的位置，因爲你看着它打過來。

sentences.english: Now the first bolt of lightning stabs the earth .
sentences.chinese: 這時，第一個雷電劈向大地。

sentences.english: Zeus stabs the sky with thunderbolts.
sentences.chinese: 宙斯用雷電刺穿了天空。

sentences.english: Any of the three one-eyed Titans who forged thunderbolts for Zeus.
sentences.chinese: 幫助宙斯製造雷電地三個獨眼泰坦神之一。

sentences.english: Chaton brand BT - 2002 type powerful grounding resistance reduction agent committed to lightning protection of the overall program.
sentences.chinese: 型強效接地降阻劑致力於雷電防護的整體方案。

sentences.english: Relentless, dangerous thunderstorms and heavy rains continued to slow relief efforts.
sentences.chinese: 無情的是，危險的雷電和暴雨繼續減慢了救災工作。

sentences.english: Anti-shortcircuit; good performance to withstand the lightning impulse.
sentences.chinese: 抗短路，耐雷電衝擊性能好。

sentences.english: It had just entered a stormy area with strong turbulence, she said.
sentences.chinese: 飛機只是剛飛進雷電區就碰上了強氣流，她說道。

sentences.english: Look the sky, dead as lightning, and clouds as flat way.
sentences.chinese: 望長空，死寂當作雷電，雲煙視爲平途。

sentences.english: Lightning hazards usually happen in summer, they are one kind of meteorological hazards caused by stong convection.
sentences.chinese: 雷電災害多發於夏季，是強對流天氣災害的一種。

sentences.english: Lightning occurs the most frequently in the urban area, secondly in the northeast part of the city.
sentences.chinese: 廣州市區是雷電的高發區，其次是其東北部山區。

sentences.english: There will be a heavy storm with thunder and lightning tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚將有雷電交加的大暴雨。

sentences.english: Above was an angry sky, from which rain fell and in which lightning played.
sentences.chinese: 大山之上是怒吼的天空，大雨滂沱，雷電肆虐。

sentences.english: Leon (or Léon or León) is a name in several Germanic languages meaning "thunder, " and can be used as both a given name and a surname.
sentences.chinese: 在日爾曼語系裏的意思是“雷電”，可被用作姓或名。

sentences.english: The article discussed the lightning proof design of hydrogen make machine room mainly .
sentences.chinese: 重點論術了制氫機房的雷電防護設計。

definition: sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
the sky/the firmament/the vault of heaven
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
